text: Humans use only 10 percent of their brain.
label: ten_percent_brain_myth

text: Humans use all of their brain, with different areas active at different times.
label: ten_percent_brain_truth

text: Sugar makes children hyperactive.
label: sugar_hyperactive_myth

text: Controlled studies show sugar does not cause hyperactivity in children.
label: sugar_hyperactive_truth

text: You lose most body heat through your head.
label: head_heat_loss_myth

text: Heat loss through the head is roughly proportional to its surface area.
label: head_heat_loss_truth

text: Reading in dim light damages your eyes.
label: dim_light_eyes_myth

text: Reading in dim light causes temporary eye strain but no permanent damage.
label: dim_light_eyes_truth

text: Cracking your knuckles causes arthritis.
label: knuckle_arthritis_myth

text: Cracking your knuckles does not cause arthritis.
label: knuckle_arthritis_truth

text: Cold weather causes colds.
label: cold_weather_colds_myth

text: Colds are caused by viruses, not cold weather.
label: cold_weather_colds_truth

text: Eating carrots significantly improves your night vision.
label: carrots_vision_myth

text: Carrots provide vitamin A but do not enhance normal vision beyond baseline.
label: carrots_vision_truth

text: You must wait 30 minutes after eating before swimming.
label: swimming_after_eating_myth

text: There is no medical reason to wait after eating before swimming.
label: swimming_after_eating_truth

text: Shaving makes hair grow back thicker and darker.
label: shaving_thicker_myth

text: Shaving does not affect the thickness or color of hair regrowth.
label: shaving_thicker_truth

text: We swallow eight spiders a year in our sleep.
label: swallow_spiders_myth

text: Spiders are unlikely to crawl into a sleeping person's mouth.
label: swallow_spiders_truth

text: Antibiotics are effective against viruses.
label: antibiotics_viruses_myth

text: Antibiotics are only effective against bacteria, not viruses.
label: antibiotics_viruses_truth

text: Eating late at night causes weight gain.
label: late_night_eating_myth

text: Weight gain depends on total caloric intake, not the time of day.
label: late_night_eating_truth

text: Vaccines cause autism.
label: vaccines_autism_myth

text: Extensive research has found no link between vaccines and autism.
label: vaccines_autism_truth

text: You need to drink eight glasses of water a day.
label: eight_glasses_water_myth

text: Water needs vary by individual and there is no scientific basis for eight glasses.
label: eight_glasses_water_truth

text: Going outside with wet hair will make you sick.
label: wet_hair_sick_myth

text: Wet hair does not cause illness, which is caused by viruses and bacteria.
label: wet_hair_sick_truth
